title: Plain-Det: A Plain Multi-Dataset Object Detector
authors: Cheng Shi, Yuchen Zhu and Sibei Yang
abstract:
Recent advancements in large-scale foundational models have sparked
widespread interest in training highly proficient large vision models. A common
consensus revolves around the necessity of aggregating extensive, high-quality
annotated data. However, given the inherent challenges in annotating dense
tasks in computer vision, such as object detection and segmentation, a
practical strategy is to combine and leverage all available data for training
purposes. In this work, we propose Plain-Det, which offers flexibility to
accommodate new datasets, robustness in performance across diverse datasets,
training efficiency, and compatibility with various detection architectures. We
utilize Def-DETR, with the assistance of Plain-Det, to achieve a mAP of 51.9 on
COCO, matching the current state-of-the-art detectors. We conduct extensive
experiments on 13 downstream datasets and Plain-Det demonstrates strong
generalization capability. Code is release at
https://github.com/ChengShiest/Plain-Det
subjects: Computing Research Repository/Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition
